O2Jam Map Set Object Metadata¶

This holds the metadata for the O2Jam Map Set

This is directly inherited by O2JMapSetObj to allow acsess to all the extra metadata

class reamber.o2jam.O2JMapSetObjMeta.O2JMapGenre¶

This is a class of static variables that indicate the genre of the song

class reamber.o2jam.O2JMapSetObjMeta.O2JMapSetObjMeta(songId: int = 0, signature: str = '', encodeVersion: float = 0.0, genre: int = 0, bpm: float = 0.0, level: List[int] = <factory>, eventCount: List[int] = <factory>, noteCount: List[int] = <factory>, measureCount: List[int] = <factory>, packageCount: List[int] = <factory>, oldEncodeVersion: int = 0, oldSongId: int = 0, oldGenre: bytes = b'', bmpSize: int = 0, oldFileVersion: int = 0, title: str = '', artist: str = '', creator: str = '', ojmFile: str = '', coverSize: int = 0, duration: List[int] = <factory>, noteOffset: List[int] = <factory>, coverOffset: int = 0)¶

This class contains the readable metadata of the map

This can be extracted from the first 300 bytes of every ojn file.

readMeta(metadata: bytes)¶

Reads the metadata of the map

Parameters

metadata – The first 300 bytes go here

writeMeta(f) → bytes¶

Unimplemented, writes the metadata of a ojn file

I don’t think I’ll implement this unless there’s clear support on this

reamberPy
